title: Tomoko Muramatsu
text:
is a Japanese <a href="Association%20football">football</a> player. She plays for <a href="Nippon%20TV%20Tokyo%20Verdy%20Beleza">Tokyo Verdy Beleza</a> in the <a href="WE%20League">WE League</a>. She played for <a href="Japan%20women%27s%20national%20football%20team">Japan national team</a>.
Club career.
Muramatsu was born in <a href="Setagaya">Setagaya</a>, <a href="Tokyo">Tokyo</a> on October 23, 1994. She was promoted to <a href="Nippon%20TV%20Beleza">Nippon TV Beleza</a> from youth team in 2011. She was selected Best Eleven in <a href="2015%20L.League">2015</a> and <a href="2016%20L.League">2016</a>.
National team career.
In 2010, Muramatsu was selected <a href="Japan%20women%27s%20national%20under-17%20football%20team">Japan U-17 national team</a> for <a href="2010%20FIFA%20U-17%20Women%27s%20World%20Cup">2010 U-17 World Cup</a>. She played 5 games and Japan won 2nd place. In August 2015, she was selected <a href="Japan%20women%27s%20national%20football%20team">Japan national team</a> for <a href="2015%20EAFF%20Women%27s%20East%20Asian%20Cup">2015 East Asian Cup</a>. At this competition, on August 4, she debuted against <a href="South%20Korea%20women%27s%20national%20football%20team">South Korea</a>. She played 4 games for Japan until 2016.
